Exaggerate: The claim of "10,000 DEAD in Wuhan, China" exaggerates the number of deaths caused by the Wuhan coronavirus. The actual death toll at the time was 81.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion of 10,000 deaths. The only source provided is an unconfirmed email without any other evidence.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the actual death toll at the time was 81, not thousands.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the number of deaths is in the thousands without any reliable evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents an alternative explanation to the actual death toll by suggesting a much higher number without any credible sources or evidence.
